conclusion: To find the magnitude of the magnetic induction intensity B using the principles of the current balance and forces on the coil.
The image shows a balance with weights and a rectangular coil in a magnetic field.
When current I flows through the coil in the magnetic field B, it experiences a Lorentz force.
The force on each side of the coil is given by F = n * I * L * B.
The total force on the coil is 2 * n * I * L * B.
Initially, the right arm with the coil is balanced without any extra weight on the left pan.
When the current is reversed, the direction of the Lorentz force also reverses.
To balance the system again, an additional weight m needs to be added to the left pan.
The force due to the weight m is mg.
The force required to balance the system when the current is reversed is equal to the weight m, i.e., 2 * n * I * L * B = mg.
Rearrange the equation to solve for B: B = mg / (2 * n * I * L).
The magnetic induction intensity B is given by B = mg / (2 * n * I * L).
